metadata.title: CVE-2019-17005 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: The plain text serializer used a fixed-size array for the number of <ol> elements it could process; however it was possible to overflow the static-sized array leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
